title: Bank of Canada: Economy Recovering Largely as Expected
sub_head: Deputy Governor Timothy Lane says first-quarter growth was ‘quite encouraging’
body:
The Canadian economy is recovering largely as anticipated and should see a strong rebound over the summer as the coronavirus vaccine rollout continues and economic restrictions are lifted, a Bank of Canada official said Thursday.
Deputy Governor Timothy Lane said in prepared remarks that Canada’s first-quarter growth, which fell short of the central bank’s expectation, was nonetheless “quite encouraging” and household spending during that period was stronger than anticipated.
A...
